form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to promulgate regulations to allow the use of hand-propelled vessels on certain rivers and streams that flow in and through certain Federal lands in Yellowstone National Park, Grand Teton National Park, the John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Memorial Parkway, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Yellowstone and Grand Teton Paddling Act.
For the purposes of this Act:

paragraph.text: The term hand-propelled vessel means a vessel designed for river travel that is propelled by one or more people using paddles or oars, such as canoes, inflatable kayaks, kayaks, packrafts, and rafts.
The term paddling means the use of hand-propelled vessels for descending, crossing, or otherwise floating upon rivers and streams.

subsection.text: Not later than 3 years after the date on which funds are first made available for this section, the Secretary of the Interior shall promulgate regulations to allow the use of hand-propelled vessels on waters within Yellowstone National Park in the States of Idaho, Montana, and Wyoming, and Grand Teton National Park and the John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Memorial Parkway in the State of Wyoming. Waters where such use shall be allowed under the regulations shall include, at a minimum, the segments listed in subsection (b).

subsection.text: The boundaries of any river proposed in subsection (b) shall generally comprise that area measured within one-quarter mile from the ordinary high water mark on each side of the listed rivers and streams. This subsection shall not be construed to limit the scope of the regulation to address areas which may lie more than one-quarter mile from the ordinary high water mark on each side of the river.
The regulations required by subsection (a) shall be promulgated in accordance with—

paragraph.text: laws, regulations, and policies generally applicable to units of the National Park System; and
sections 551 through 559 of title 5, United States Code (commonly known as the Administrative Procedure Act).
The regulations issued under this section shall not consider any expansion of commercial use of hand-propelled vessels in the parks.
Nothing in this Act shall be construed as authorizing the commercial use of hand-propelled vessels.

subsection.text: When promulgating regulations under this section, the Secretary of the Interior shall consult with the Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service and the Director of the National Park Service to help ensure that the regulations provide that recreational use of hand-propelled vessels on the Gros Ventre River within the National Elk Refuge adjacent to Grand Teton National Park is consistent with the requirements of the National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 (16 U.S.C. 668dd et seq.).
Upon issuance of the final regulations required by subsection (a), the following regulations shall have no force or effect:

paragraph.text: Section 7.13(d)(4)(ii) of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations (regarding vessels on streams and rivers in Yellowstone National Park).
Section 7.22(e)(3) of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations (regarding vessels on lakes and rivers in Grand Teton National Park).

subsection.text: The Secretary is authorized to recover all costs, in accordance with section 103104 of title 54, United States Code, associated with monitoring the use of hand-propelled vessels, including the cost of inspecting and decontaminating vessels to prevent the introduction or spread of invasive or injurious species in Yellowstone National Park, Grand Teton National Park, and the John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Memorial Parkway.
